intro: Grammitis cyclosora, commonly known as the cyclosora fern, is a species of epiphytic fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, Sri Lanka, and parts of Southeast Asia. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, anchoring itself with its rhizomes while its fronds spread out to capture light. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a delicate, feathery appearance. Grammitis cyclosora thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
